title: [$500] Private Note - Code block paste in private notes does not work (works fine in native apps)

labels.name: Internal
labels.description: Requires API changes or must be handled by Expensify staff

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @garrettmknight (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.
Job added to Upwork: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~013e368c7fef7e59bc

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync

I'm unsure about the differences in the code you provided. It is similar to the code in Composer. Please update your proposal with the specific code changes and provide more details, especially regarding the exact file where these changes should be applied, by linking it in the proposal.
>

Yes, reusable code, that's exactly what I proposed under `What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)`  @ArekChr .
Now I have updated my [proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29806#issuecomment-1766975028) with a working custom hook that can be used in both places. Thx!!
📣 It's been a week! Do we have any satisfactory proposals yet? Do we need to adjust the bounty for this issue? 💸

@ArekChr did you check my updated [proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29806#issuecomment-1766975028)? I updated it with the custom hook implementation and result video but if it is better I can also implement the HOC implementation 👍 .
Updated [comment](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29806#issuecomment-1766975028)
@FitseTLT I’m going to check your proposal again soon. I just need a bit more time to look into how code blocks can be pasted on web platforms to make sure your solution works properly.
@ArekChr will you be able to review this week?
@garrettmknight Hello, I am wrapping up some urgent matters today, and I will be OOO from tomorrow to Monday. Can we assign another C+ here so as not to block the task?

Hey @Santhosh-Sellavel - we have a proposal ready for review on this one: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29806#issuecomment-1780831127

@garrettmknight @Santhosh-Sellavel this issue was created 2 weeks ago. Are we close to approving a proposal? If not, what's blocking us from getting this issue assigned? Don't hesitate to create a thread in #expensify-open-source to align faster in real time. Thanks!

Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @robertKozik (`External`)
Hey @robertKozik - we have a proposal ready for review on this one: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29806#issuecomment-1780831127

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
Private Note - Code block paste in private notes does not work (works fine in native apps)
### What is the root cause of that problem?
On native, we saved as Text.
But on web, we save as HTML here.
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/a31933a049b9a9aa4222a4d3edab19b54a4555b7/src/pages/home/report/ContextMenu/ContextMenuActions.js#L286-L291
So on native work well and not work on web.

On composer, there are custom paste function to parse some like html format.
But there is not on PrivateNotesEditPage
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/a31933a049b9a9aa4222a4d3edab19b54a4555b7/src/components/Composer/index.js#L377
### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
I think we copy html as text for platform.
Replace this.
```
Clipboard.setString(parser.htmlToMarkdown(content));
```
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/a31933a049b9a9aa4222a4d3edab19b54a4555b7/src/pages/home/report/ContextMenu/ContextMenuActions.js#L286-L291
### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
We need to add paste module for all input.
or BaseInput.


https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/65789015/a8367cf0-accb-4c90-ae2c-7d28e5f0c589

And I found one issue here.
Current private note is not same with draft note of edit page 
You can check on video
@robertKozik can you give this one a look when you get a chance?

@garrettmknight @robertKozik this issue is now 3 weeks old. There is one more week left before this issue breaks WAQ and will need to go internal. What needs to happen to get a PR in review this week? Please create a thread in #expensify-open-source to discuss. Thanks!
📣 It's been a week! Do we have any satisfactory proposals yet? Do we need to adjust the bounty for this issue? 💸

Hi all! sorry for keep you waiting for so long. I've get familiar with the issue a little and I think that the root cause here is that `TextInput` on the Private Notes screen doesn't support pasting HTML content (like it is in `Composer` example). 

After getting acquainted with both of the avaiable proposal, I can see flaws on both of them, which I want to point uout separetly:
- @yh-0218: your proposal is getting rid of not only the issue, but the correctly implemented part of the code as well. We should still be able to copy/paste the HTML content, not only as string. The `Clipboard.canSetHtml` function, which you want to get rid of, is exacly for this purpose - enable the HTML copying
- @FitseTLT - your solution would work, but it would require from us to create platform-dependant versions of the edit private notes screen as we are creating listeners on `document` object. In my opinion it's not worth it in this case to condemn contributors to maintain both very similar versions of code. But **I like more your alternative solution** to pass the markdown version of content as `text/plain`. If you could update your proposal so this one would be the primary solution I would be glad.

I believe that the secondary solution from the @FitseTLT is the most promising. From mine point of view copying function should copy the contant ideally with formatting, so exposing both versions HTML and Markdown of the content is expected here
@robertKozik Updated [Proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29806#issuecomment-1766975028) according to your suggestion 👍

Thanks @FitseTLT for updating. I believe it should be the way to go, but I'm open to discussion about this.

🎀 👀 🎀 C+ reviewed
Triggered auto assignment to @flodnv, see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/7972 for more details.

Hmmm, it seems we are saying that native has the correct behavior whilst web does not. I am not sure I agree with this opinion. When I copy the text from `test` in any app, including here, "test" gets copied to my clipboard, not \`test\`.

What do you think @garrettmknight @robertKozik ?

@flodnv Copying to clipboard from a report action is specifically designed to support both plain text and html, here: 
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/73a3e7261b28ad9def8dca4e6c9dac238cd0821e/src/pages/home/report/ContextMenu/ContextMenuActions.js#L273-L292
So if you select text from `test` from a report action still it will copy "test" because it prioritize selection over the report action message :
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/73a3e7261b28ad9def8dca4e6c9dac238cd0821e/src/pages/home/report/ContextMenu/ContextMenuActions.js#L273
But if you copy from the context menu without selecting any text it will copy `test` (the code block).
So according to our design (code) the expected behaviour when a user copies a report action message (that is a code block) from our context menu is to copy the code block to clipboard, this is a specific feature already incorporated in the app so that users can copy the exact report action message (whether it is code block or simple plain text) so don't confuse it with the common/default copying mechanism that exists in other apps (including github). 👍

The behavior of copy/pasting via selection (similar to GitHub) will remain unchanged, and the content won't have the styling. My rationale was that copying via the action menu should preserve both content and styling.

Currently, copying a message via the action menu will only maintain markdown styling when pasted into an input adapted for pasting HTML content. Even if we were to adapt our input for HTML, pasting into another app may not always preserve the styling. In current implementation we are assuming that web platform should be able to set/get HTML, which is not always the true. 

If we would not agree with the copying markdown representation of the content I would suggest creating the special TextInput component (something like `HtmlAwareInput`) which would be able to handle pasting HTML. On a downside we will be sentenced to maintain this kind of the component, which would have separate implementation for web and native.

>So according to our design (code) the expected behaviour

Indeed, I am challenging the expected behavior (current design). 

>So if you select text from test from a report action still it will copy "test" because it prioritize selection over the report action message :
>The behavior of copy/pasting via selection (similar to GitHub) will remain unchanged, and the content won't have the styling.

Actually I just tested and it copied `test` (the code block). So, is that a bug?

> Actually I just tested and it copied test (the code block). So, is that a bug?

Ok. You 're right it copies the code block. 👍 

> Indeed, I am challenging the expected behavior (current design).

I think we should choose the more inclusive markdown over the plain text. And also as a user copies from the report action context menu he expects to have a content similar (both content and styling) to the report action content on pasting.
@garrettmknight, @flodnv, @robertKozik Whoops! This issue is 2 days overdue. Let's get this updated quick!
@garrettmknight, @flodnv, @robertKozik Uh oh! This issue is overdue by 2 days. Don't forget to update your issues!

> I think we should choose the more inclusive markdown over the plain text. And also as a user copies from the report action context menu he expects to have a content similar (both content and styling) to the report action content on pasting.

If that's the case copying the markdown would be inline with the selection copy in newDot

@garrettmknight @flodnv @robertKozik this issue is now 4 weeks old and preventing us from maintaining WAQ, can you:
- Decide whether any proposals currently meet our guidelines and can be approved as-is today
- If no proposals meet that standard, please take this issue internal and treat it as one of your highest priorities
- If you have any questions, don't hesitate to start a discussion in #expensify-open-source

Thanks!
Current assignee @robertKozik is eligible for the Internal assigner, not assigning anyone new.
@garrettmknight, @flodnv, @robertKozik Huh... This is 4 days overdue. Who can take care of this?
@robertKozik what do you think?
I assigned @FitseTLT, not sure why Melvin did not comment

⚠️ Looks like this issue was linked to a **Deploy Blocker** [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31805)

If you are the assigned CME please investigate whether the linked PR caused a regression and leave a comment with the results.

If a regression has occurred and you are the assigned CM follow the instructions [here](https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/13647).

If this regression could have been avoided please consider also proposing a recommendation to the PR checklist so that we can avoid it in the future.
PR was reverted: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31852
@flodnv When I create a PR should I link it to this issue or the other ??
This one; we'll close the other one soon

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.3.85.0 **Reproducible in staging?:** y **Reproducible in production?:** y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @dhanashree-sawant **Slack conversation:** https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1697530399668279 ## Action Performed: 1. Open the app 2. Open any user report 3. Send 3 backtick code block eg: ```Hii``` 4. Hover and click copy to clipboard 5. Click on header to open user details 6. Click on privates notes-> my notes 7. Paste the copied text and observe that app removes backticks while pasting ## Expected Result: App should paste text with backticks in private notes ## Actual Result: App does not paste text with private notes (works fine only in native apps) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos
Android: Native
Android: mWeb Chrome https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/fe21985a-eaf4-459a-b788-30c338892c6b
iOS: Native
iOS: mWeb Safari https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/db2f07e0-7046-4f05-9fa6-957755079814
MacOS: Chrome / Safari https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/5b66b28c-a05d-4afd-b21f-903255894055 https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/d26511ec-d51c-462f-8506-fefb5be72563
MacOS: Desktop https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/7212464f-bcdd-42e4-81f0-42bac2828632
